title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to cut 20% of its workforce, merging Tripadvisor and Viator operations focused on AI and user experiences.
The reorganization includes an $85 million cost-savings program and aims for a simpler, faster-moving organization, impacting about 600 employees.
Activist investor Starboard Value holds a 9% stake and has influenced strategic adjustments amid company's post-pandemic challenges.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A hiker found an abandoned tent on Oct. 26 at the Valley Way site in New Hampshire's White Mountains.
Search and rescue officials found car keys but no matching vehicle, and there are no missing hiker reports.
Posts about the tent in hiking groups attracted attention, but no owner has come forward with information.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader and CharityTeams founder, passed away on November 1, 2025.
She raised $42 million for nonprofits, training Boston Marathon runners and organizing charity events.
A Celebration of Life for Susan will be held on November 8 at Waters Church Norwood, Massachusetts.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket has launched its own beer, 'More For Your Dollar' lager, in collaboration with Zero Gravity Beer.
The 12-pack lager, priced at $12.99, is available at MB Spirits and MB Beer & Wine locations in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire.
The beer introduction occurs during a transition for Market Basket after the departure of CEO Arthur T. Demoulas.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: The Supreme Judicial Court heard arguments on whether judges can grant pay raises to court-appointed attorneys amid a work stoppage.
Public defenders in Massachusetts staged a work stoppage in May, demanding increased pay, leaving over 900 defendants without representation.
State lawmakers approved a pay raise in August, but over 900 defendants remain unrepresented as the SJC considers judicial intervention.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston to sign copies of her debut novel co-authored with Harlan Coben.
Witherspoon was in Boston to speak at Harvard Business School, where she discussed her movie 'Legally Blonde' and business initiatives.
Her novel 'Gone Before Goodbye' is a New York Times bestselling thriller, marking her successful entry into the literary world.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, a former aide to Gov. Maura Healey, was arrested for cocaine trafficking to a state office building.
GOP lawmakers demand answers from Healey on Cook's hiring process and past criminal record going undetected.
Republican gubernatorial candidates call for an independent investigation into Healey's staff vetting practices.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two teens were killed in a crash on Route 140 South in New Bedford, Massachusetts, early Saturday.
Victims identified as Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, of West Yarmouth, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, of Dartmouth.
The 18-year-old driver, also from Dartmouth, was injured and hospitalized; the crash investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are seeking public help to identify a suspect involved in multiple commercial burglaries since August 21.
The suspect has reportedly stolen credit cards, cash, and electronics from downtown businesses using a pry tool.
Similar break-ins have been reported by Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University police through September 25.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tennessee Titans reportedly avoided trades with New England Patriots due to owner Amy Adams Strunk's issues with Mike Vrabel.
Mike Vrabel, now Patriots' head coach, previously led Titans but was dismissed after a 6-11 season and internal conflicts.
The Titans, currently 1-8, fired Vrabel's successor just before losing to the Patriots, who are led by Vrabel.
